result.execSummary:
The defendant Shelly R Schaumann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
$443.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count #2.
Consecutive to: jail time on count #2.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol & no entering upon the premises of any business that sells alcohol except to pay for necessities (gas, groceries).

Defendant must take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed.

Must advise doctors or treating physicians that if they would prescribe pain pills in the future, defendant must inform them that she has/had and addiction to pain pills.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with any treatment plans given in inpatient treatment and follow all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time allowed.
Eligible for community service under 973.03(3).
Defendant must report in 30 days and will receive credit towards the balance of the jail time for any time spent in a successful inpatient treatment facility.

records.addlTxt: State's Settlement Recommendation

Called at 1:30 PM. Shelly Schaumann appears in person and with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. Roley - resolved - provides court with plea questionnaire and letter from the defendant (provides same letter to DA). Court and State review letter submitted by the defendant. State - joint recommendation - plead G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, #3, #4 and #5 are to be DRI; on count #2 - 30 days in FC jail - 10 days credit, court costs only; on count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - consecutive to jail time on count #2 - with conditions of: $750 plus costs and surcharges totalling $2181.75 (with DNA surcharge and drug abuse surcharge), AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars or similar class B establishments, employment/school, 100 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed. Roley and Schaumann agree. Schaumann pleads G to counts #1 and #2. Court dismisses and reads in counts #3, #4 and #5. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Roley makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks for time to report for stated reasons - informs Court that the poster is requesting the bond money back. Poster makes statement. Court will refund bond to poster, suggests money to be used for inpatient treatment. Schaumann makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #2 - 30 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 10 days - report in 30 days and will receive credit towards the balance of the jail time for any time spent in a successful inpatient treatment facility, costs including $200 DNA cost- paid thru probation on count #1; count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - consecutive to jail time on count #2 - with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, $750 fine plus costs and surcharges totalling $2181.75 (with DNA surcharge and drug abuse surcharge) - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru,  follow thru with any treatment plans given in inpatient treatment, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they prescribed, must advise doctors or treating physicians that if they would prescribe pain pills in the future - she must inform them that she has/had an addiction to pain pills, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on September 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 11:37 AM. Shelly Schaumann appears in person and with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Roley - received discovery and an offer in July but has not had a chance to go over it with the defendant. Court will allow an adjournment. Court continues bond, set for another FPT on 9/3/14 at 1:15 PM.
State's
reset bond at FPT as additional $700 posted on 4/23/14 that was not attached to case. #14R 001051
Final pre-trial on August 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shelly R Schaumann in court with attorney Thomas C Roley.  Charles J Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:19 pm. State calls Daniel Bauknecht direct/sworn 4:20 p.m. Roley cross 4;27 pm. State object (relevance) sustained 4:28 pm. Tom Robinson called/sworn 4:30 pm direct by state. Record reflect identification of defendant 4:33 pm. Roley cross 4:37 pm. Court finds probable cause binds over information filed (mirror) has information waive reading pleads NG to counts. bond continued  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on July 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 9:13 AM. Shelly Schaumann appears in person and with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. Roley has complaint, waives reading, requests PH. Court continues bond, set for PH on 7/2/14 at 3:00 PM.
Defendant needs to sign amended cash bond
Take all medications as prescribed by health care providers. - amended
Adjourned initial appearance on May 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Called at 9:09 AM. Shelly Schaumann appears via video from FOSO and her attorney Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns does have complaint, has not gone thru it with the defendant, Burns only appearing specially today as she will have a conflict. Schaumann has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Schaumann understands charges/penalties. Burns informs court that the defendant is eligible for SPD, will be living with mother if bond is posted. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 5/28/14 at 9:00 AM. State - bond - would like to add a condition of take all medications as prescribed for stated reasons. Court - bond - take all medications as prescribed by health care providers. Defendant's mother makes statement regarding getting her into treatment - was told that a Judge could order her to enter a rehab facility. Court refers to Burns. Burns responds. Court informs them to check again regarding entrance into Koinonia, Court informs that there is nothing that he can order at this stage and explains.
